item.title: 5 Ways of Generating Fibonacci Numbers
item.description: This is just a quick note about 5 ways of generating Fibonacci numbers. Here, I want to create a function whose argument is an int number “n” (representing which number to return in the Fibonacci sequence). This function will return the Fibonacci number I want. In my definition for this question, I want the Fibonacci sequence to start from 0. 1. Recursion without Cache 1 2 3 4 5 def fib(n): if n <= 2: return n - 1 else: return fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2) The time complexity of this function is $O(1.
